org.ietf.nea.pt.socket.simple

Class DefaultNegotiationResponder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ietf.nea.pt.socket.simple.DefaultNegotiationResponder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Negotiator

    public class DefaultNegotiationResponder
extends Object
implements Negotiator
    Default version negotiation implementation for responder in a the version negotiation phase of a transport connection. This negotiator has side effects. A new negotiator must be added for every connection that should be negotiated. The negotiator is not reusable

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultNegotiationResponder

        public DefaultNegotiationResponder(short minVersion,
                           short maxVersion,
                           short prefVersion)
        Creates a default responding version negotiator. Version numbers must be >= 1.
        Parameters:
        minVersion - the minimal supported version number
        maxVersion - the maximum supported version number
        prefVersion - the preferred version number

      • getNegotiatedVersion

        public short getNegotiatedVersion()
        Description copied from interface: Negotiator
        Returns the negotiated version number after a call to Negotiator.negotiate(SocketMessenger).
        Specified by:
        getNegotiatedVersion in interface Negotiator
        Returns:
        the negotiated version or 0 if version negotiation is pending or has failed

      • negotiate

        public void negotiate(SocketMessenger wrappedSocket)
               throws SerializationException,
                      ValidationException,
                      ConnectionException
        Description copied from interface: Negotiator
        Executes the transport protocol version negotiation with a remote peer.
        Specified by:
        negotiate in interface Negotiator
        Throws:
        SerializationException - if an error occurs at message serialization
        ValidationException - if an error occurs at message parsing
        ConnectionException - if the connection is broken

      • chooseVersion

        private void chooseVersion(TransportMessage message)
                    throws ValidationException
        Handles the received version request message and sets the negotiatedVersion member variable.
        Parameters:
        message - the version request message
        Throws:
        ValidationException - if the received version request does not contain a version within the supported version range
